required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Effect of Food on the Pharmacokinetics of Single Dose RO5185426 And the Safety And Efficacy of Continuous Administration in Patients With BRAF V600E Mutation-Positive Metastatic Melanoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Randomized, Open-label, Multi-center, Two Period Crossover Study to Investigate the Effect of Food on the Pharmacokinetics of a Single Oral Dose of RO5185426, Followed by Administration of 960 mg RO5185426 Twice Daily to BRAF V600E Positive Metastatic Melanoma Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This randomized, open-label, two period crossover study will evaluate the effect of food on the pharmacokinetics of a single dose of RO5185426 and the efficacy and safety of continuous administration in patients with BRAF V600E mutation-positive metastatic melanoma. Patients will be randomized to receive in a crossover design single oral doses of RO5185426 with or without food, with a 10-day washout period between doses. Following the crossover periods, patients will receive RO5185426 orally twice daily on a continuous basis until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity occurs.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC [0-inf]) in the Fasted and Fed States
primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) analyses was performed after the completion of Period A and Period B of this study for all participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of the Sample With Last Measurable Concentration (AUC[0-last]) in the Fasted and Fed States
primary_outcome.description: PK analyses was performed after the completion of Period A and Period B of this study for all participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximal Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) in the Fasted and Fed States
primary_outcome.description: PK analyses was performed after the completion of Period A and Period B of this study for all participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Minimum Observed (Trough) Plasma Concentration (Cmin) in the Fasted and Fed States
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Periods A and B
primary_outcome.description: Single dose Pre-dose concentration is referred as Cmin here. PK analyses was performed after the completion of Period A and Period B of this study for all participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximal Plasma Concentration (Tmax) in the Fasted and Fed States
primary_outcome.description: PK analyses was performed after the completion of Period A and Period B of this study for all participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Terminal Elimination Half-Life (t1/2) in the Fasted and Fed States
primary_outcome.description: T1/2 is the time required for the concentration of the drug to reach half of its original value. PK analyses was performed after the completion of Period A and Period B of this study for all participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent First-order Terminal Elimination Rate Constant (Kel) in the Fasted and Fed States
primary_outcome.description: Apparent first-order terminal elimination rate constant (kel), was calculated as the negative slope of the linear regression of the terminal phase in plasma vemurafenib concentration-time profile using specific appropriate time points. PK analyses was performed after the completion of Period A and Period B of this study for all participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Best Objective Response (BOR) as Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then Day 1 of Cycle 3 and 5 (21-day cycle) at Period C thereafter every 2 cycles until Cycle 12 followed by every 4 cycles from Cycle 13 until disease progression or death (Up to Week 124)
secondary_outcome.description: BOR was defined as the best objective response assessed by investigator during the treatment period according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. BOR was the best response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment taking into account any requirement for confirmation. It is defined as the number of participants whose best objective response was complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) divided by the total number of efficacy evaluable participants. CR: disappearance of all non-target lesions and normalization of tumor marker level. All lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) were non-pathological in size (less than [<] 10 millimeter [mm] short axis). PR: at least a 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then Day 1 of Cycle 3 and 5 (21-day cycle) at Period C thereafter every 2 cycles until Cycle 12 followed by every 4 cycles from Cycle 13 until death (Up to Week 124)
secondary_outcome.description: OS was defined as the time, in months, from the date of the first study drug to the date of death, regardless of the cause of death.

intervention.description: Single oral dose, with high fat meal

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients, >/= 18 years of age
- Histologically confirmed metastatic melanoma (Stage IV, American Joint Committee on Cancer)
- Positive BRAF V600E mutation result determined by Cobas 4800 BRAF V600 Mutation Test
- Previously treated patients must have failed at least one prior treatment regimen; if patients have received prior systemic treatments for metastatic melanoma, the time elapsed from previous therapy must be >/= 28 days; patients must have recovered fully from toxicities of all prior therapy
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0 or 1
- Evaluable disease (measurable for disease progression according to RECIST criteria)
- Adequate hematological, renal and liver function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active CNS lesions
- History of or known spinal cord compression or carcinomatous meningitis
- Anticipated or ongoing administration of anti-cancer therapies other than those administered in this study
- Previous malignancy within the past 5 years except for basal or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin, melanoma in-situ and carcinoma in-situ of the cervix
- Previous treatment with BRAF inhibitor (sorafenib allowed) or MEK inhibitor
- Refractory nausea or vomiting, malabsorption, external biliary shunt, or history of any type of gastrointestinal surgery that would preclude adequate absorption of study drug

group.title: Vemurafenib (RO5185426): Fasted Then Fed
group.description: Single oral dose of vemurafenib tablet at 960 milligrams (mg) on Day 1 was administered to participants in fasted condition (Period A [Day 1 to Day 10]) followed by single oral dose of vemurafenib tablet at 960 mg on Day 1 in fed condition (Period B [Day 11 to Day 20]). A washout period of 10 days was maintained between Period A and B.

group.title: Vemurafenib (RO5185426): Fed Then Fasted
group.description: Single oral dose of vemurafenib tablet at 960 mg on Day 1 was administered to participants in fed condition (Period A [Day 1 to Day 10]) followed by single oral dose of vemurafenib tablet at 960 mg on Day 1 in fasted condition Period B [Day 11 to Day 20]). A washout period of 10 days was maintained between Period A and B.

group.title: Vemurafenib (RO5185426)
group.description: Participants received vemurafenib tablet at 960 mg orally twice daily in 21-day cycles starting from Day 21 until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or consent withdrawal (Period C).

baseline.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of vemurafenib.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Included all participants who received single oral dose of vemurafenib tablet at 960 mg in fasted condition first and fed condition first in Period A and Period B and twice daily dose of vemurafenib tablet at 960 mg in Period C.

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC [0-inf]) in the Fasted and Fed States
outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) analyses was performed after the completion of Period A and Period B of this study for all participants.
outcome.population: PK analysis population included participants who received both single doses of vemurafenib in Periods A and B without protocol violation and provided adequate PK assessments to calculate important PK parameters. Here “number of participants analyzed”=participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

group.title: Vemurafenib (RO5185426): Fasted
group.description: Single oral dose of vemurafenib tablet at 960 mg on Day 1 was administered to participants in fasted condition, in any intervention periods (Period A or B).

group.title: Vemurafenib (RO5185426): Fed
group.description: Single oral dose of vemurafenib tablet at 960 mg on Day 1 was administered to participants in fed condition, in any intervention periods (Period A or B).

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC [0-inf]) in the Fasted and Fed States
measure.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) analyses was performed after the completion of Period A and Period B of this study for all participants.
measure.population: PK analysis population included participants who received both single doses of vemurafenib in Periods A and B without protocol violation and provided adequate PK assessments to calculate important PK parameters. Here “number of participants analyzed”=participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

analysis.groups_desc: The point estimate and 90 percent (%) confidence interval (CI) of vemurafenib plasma AUC geometric means ratios of the Fed to Fasted conditions following an oral administration of a single dose of 960 mg vemurafenib were analyzed.

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of the Sample With Last Measurable Concentration (AUC[0-last]) in the Fasted and Fed States
outcome.description: PK analyses was performed after the completion of Period A and Period B of this study for all participants.
outcome.population: PK analysis population. Here “number of participants analyzed”=participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Best Objective Response (BOR) as Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
outcome.description: BOR was defined as the best objective response assessed by investigator during the treatment period according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. BOR was the best response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment taking into account any requirement for confirmation. It is defined as the number of participants whose best objective response was complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) divided by the total number of efficacy evaluable participants. CR: disappearance of all non-target lesions and normalization of tumor marker level. All lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) were non-pathological in size (less than [<] 10 millimeter [mm] short axis). PR: at least a 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then Day 1 of Cycle 3 and 5 (21-day cycle) at Period C thereafter every 2 cycles until Cycle 12 followed by every 4 cycles from Cycle 13 until disease progression or death (Up to Week 124)
outcome.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included participants with measurable disease who received at least 1 dose of vemurafenib. Here “number of participants analyzed”=participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

group.title: Vemurafenib (RO5185426)
group.description: Participants received vemurafenib tablet at 960 mg orally twice daily in 21-day cycles starting from Day 21 until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or consent withdrawal (Period C).

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Best Objective Response (BOR) as Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
measure.description: BOR was defined as the best objective response assessed by investigator during the treatment period according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) version 1.1. BOR was the best response recorded from the start of the study treatment until the end of treatment taking into account any requirement for confirmation. It is defined as the number of participants whose best objective response was complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) divided by the total number of efficacy evaluable participants. CR: disappearance of all non-target lesions and normalization of tumor marker level. All lymph nodes (whether target or non-target) were non-pathological in size (less than [<] 10 millimeter [mm] short axis). PR: at least a 30 percent (%) decrease in the sum of diameters of target lesions, taking as reference the baseline sum diameters.
measure.population: Intent-to-treat (ITT) population included participants with measurable disease who received at least 1 dose of vemurafenib. Here “number of participants analyzed”=participants who were evaluable for this outcome measure.

outcome.title: Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: OS was defined as the time, in months, from the date of the first study drug to the date of death, regardless of the cause of death.
outcome.time_frame: From Baseline then Day 1 of Cycle 3 and 5 (21-day cycle) at Period C thereafter every 2 cycles until Cycle 12 followed by every 4 cycles from Cycle 13 until death (Up to Week 124)
outcome.population: Data for OS was not collected as there was a change in planned analysis, not to collect the data.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor’s intellectual property rights.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Results for OS was not reported due to change in planned analysis.
